column4: Does anyone know where I'd look if Ubuntu is being weird with a specific USB device?
did you look at your dmesg output already?
Yeah, nothing.
Pressing buttons on the USB device causes gdm to restart. ;P
wow, lovely. kernel issue?
I'm hoping it's not a problem with kernel, because the device has no specific drivers.
It's a usb audo/HID hybrid all the info is in the descriptors.
i don't think i can help much without more info, what exactly is the device?
Logitech G930
I am just fighting lsusb for the descriptors
oO, is that a camera?
No
Don't ask about the logitech webcam on my desk
That causes lock-ups in Linux
I shoulda learned really. ;P
haha, yeah sounds like kernel issues, sorry i'm not more helpful
Yeah, the camera one definitely is.
It's due to Linux being far too optimistic in usbcore.
But the G930 is a pita, because sometimes it works fine, and just replugging doesn't seem to fix. I have to reboot. Which makes me think it's a service setting it up crazy.
Argh, I think I'm gonna have to believe it's logitech being shite with USB again.
yeah, i have a dual-boot desktop that makes me unplug the mouse and plug it back in everytime i switch, or the scroll wheel will go into SUPER sensitive mode
lol
Thanks for your thoughts on my problem btw. :)
